title: TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for *: 'NoneType' and 'float'
body:
**My Operating system and DeepLabCut version**
windows 10, with an Anaconda Env, & Deeplabcut 2.0.8

**Describe the problem**
I want to use yourowndata.ipnnb to create my project. First several steps are ok, there was no mistake. But when I use deeplabcut.label_frames function, it appears ok, it can display the folders I have saved extract frames. When I select one of these folders and click button. It occurs typeerror like this:

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
D:\Anaconda\envs\dlc-windowsGPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut-2.0.8-py3.6.egg\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\labeling_toolbox.py in browseDir(self, event)
    466         self.img = self.index[self.iter]
    467         img_name = Path(self.index[self.iter]).name
--> 468         self.norm,self.colorIndex = self.image_panel.getColorIndices(self.img,self.bodyparts)
    469 
    470 # Checking for new frames and adding them to the existing dataframe

D:\Anaconda\envs\dlc-windowsGPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut-2.0.8-py3.6.egg\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\labeling_toolbox.py in getColorIndices(self, img, bodyparts)
     84         im = cv2.imread(img)
     85         norm = mcolors.Normalize(vmin=0, vmax=np.max(im))
---> 86         ticks = np.linspace(0,np.max(im),len(bodyparts))[::-1]
     87         return norm, ticks
     88 

D:\Anaconda\envs\dlc-windowsGPU\lib\site-packages\numpy\core\function_base.py in linspace(start, stop, num, endpoint, retstep, dtype, axis)
    134     # and make sure one can use variables that have an __array_interface__, gh-6634
    135     start = asanyarray(start) * 1.0
--> 136     stop  = asanyarray(stop)  * 1.0
    137 
    138     dt = result_type(start, stop, float(num))

TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for *: 'NoneType' and 'float'
```

Why this happened? Can you help me to handle it? Thanks!






**How to Reproduce the problem**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error


**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
